revised_title: Trypanosome Diseases of Domestic Animals in Nyasaland: Development of Trypanosoma pecorum in Glossina morsitans
tldr: This study investigates the development of Trypanosoma pecorum in Glossina morsitans, a tsetse fly, and its implications for the transmission of trypanosome diseases in domestic animals in Nyasaland. The researchers found that the development takes place in the gut, labial cavity, and hypopharynx of the fly, with the fly becoming infective after 20 days of feeding on an infected animal.
